Description:
We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than 75 000 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.Purpose of the JobPerforming subsystem/component development activities and contributing to the purchasing of subsystems/components developed by suppliers.Organisation ReportingHierarchical Reporting: (Site) Mechanical Domain Leader (MDL)
Functional Reporting: Mechanical Lead Engineer (MLE)  Responsibilities
Accountable for :Defining best trade-off between technical input constraints in order to optimize global QCD.
Performing 3D and 2D deliverables in compliance with QCD commitments, Metier rules and processes.
Modelling and allocated volumes and interfaces for sub-systems / components in Digital Mock-Up in Catia V5 and PLM.
 Customer requirements CBC assurance
Performing Design on internal sub-systems.
Verifying consistency of digital mock-up (no clash, etc.) and compliance with requirements (allocated volumes, weight, interfaces,
etc.) on assigned scope.
Preparing and documenting Domain Design Reviews
Preparing Customer Reports
Type test procedure preparation
Prepare Type test plan & signoff with supplier
Checking CADs' in catia V5  and sub-contractor's Design Quality
Realizing stack-up analysis with Integration team support.
Realizing Bill of Material & weight managementResponsible for :Performing the transverse requirement allocations to the various subsystems in close collaboration with the relevant specialists,
Performing requirement development, coming from reference and applicable documents from Metiers, Standards, Certification, Safety, Platform and Customer
Defining the Train System architecture, operational modes and functionalities taking as input the external/internal requirements
Performing train system FMECA in coordination with RAMS team
Ensuring consistency and compatibility between all the sub-systems specifications,
Writing sub-system specification and architecture description (RSAD2) in collaboration with the SSE/PU/TCE according to train level architecture.
Fill the “Entry “connector” to question the Train design systems catalog.
For non-catalog components, under TD Systems design authority:
Writes the Technical Purchasing Specification (TPS0 - Short Specification) when needed.
Writes the TPS1 for supplier consultation and manages technical contact (TPS2) until design has been frozen
Drives technical relationships with suppliers with close management of QCD commitments (CbC), risks & validation (including Design Reviews with suppliers).
Supporting TPM to define applicable train configuration
Ensuring coordination between TD/PU/Metier on interfaces, performances, technical issues resolution during detailed design phase.
On TPM request, participating to technical meetings with customer in order to provide support.Contributor for :Perform quotation of engineering work-package, upon request
Defining Project Decomposition (PBS)
Supporting Sourcing, Industrialization and Manufacturing teams during Production ramp-up.
 Collaborating with MDL for continuous improvement of the Domain (including RoE)Performance Measurement/KPI’sClosure of open points or escalation: 10 days maximum
Compliance to Engineering WorkPackage (variation orders excluded): 100%
Quality of delivery (included sub-contractor delivery): 1st time quality rate > 90% (quality rate = modification validated OK /number of applied modification)
Respect of the delivery planning (included sub-contractor delivery) = 100% on time delivery
Application level of standard PPL = 100%
Configuration management deliverables = 100% of deliverables properly managed into configuration database

Good Communications and interpersonal skills including with third parties (customer).
Time management and reporting skill.
Sense of urgency / priority.
Structured and organised with Hands-on approach.
